page.title: 03Edburton
page.content: The parish of Edburton consists of 5 major farms 2 of which are old manors. The Saxon church of St Andrew stands on a slight hill with panoramic views through the trees to the South Downs & to the weald to the N. The building of flint & stone is of classic simplicity Its most unusual feature is the leaden font. The villagers are baptised, married & buried here. Of those who have left Edburton many make a return visit. The school at Edburton has been turned into a private house. Children travel by bus to Upper Beeding primary school. Tottington Manor besides having its own farm is now a residential hotel & resteraunt. It has a large & unusual dovecot standing separate from other buildings. Shrings sell smoked fish of many kinds can be obtained. They are suppliers of smoked salmon to airlines a big industry.
